Useful sources

  • Strategies for promoting digital citizenship and device ownership: Adcock, C. (2023). Six ways to promote digital citizenship and device ownership. TCEA Tech Notes Blog.
  • Discussion of the role of education systems in protecting children in both the physical and digital environment: Gottschalk, F. and T. Burns (2020), "Education and child safety," in Burns, T. and F. Gottschalk (eds.), Education in the Digital Age: Healthy and Happy Children, OECD Publishing, Paris, more info.
  • Information, tools, and good practice to support the development of competences to empower and protect children: Council of Europe. (2022). Digital Citizenship Education Handbook.
  • A comprehensive guide that provides information, tools, and good practice: Council of Europe. (2022). Digital Citizenship Education Handbook.
  • A set of guidelines to tackle disinformation and promote digital literacy in educational settings: European Commission, Directorate-General for Education, Youth, Sport, and Culture, more info.
  • A list of resources for teaching digital citizenship: Krueger, N. (2020). 9 resources for teaching digital citizenship.
  • Explores the subject of digital citizenship in all its complexity: OECD (2019), more info.
  • How teaching students to develop an awareness of data security, online etiquette, and cyberbullying: Poth, R. D., (2023) more info.
